name: reticulated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
arranged or having a pattern like a net of lines and squares, or a structure of pipes and wires: a reticulated pattern leaves with a reticulate vein structure See
reticulation
More examplesFewer examples Some will be collected and filtered and passed through a reticulated network of pipes.All of the school building's windows had a reticulate wire mesh built directly into the glass. Dicots usually have broad leaves with reticulate veination. It is highly reticulated, showing dense fibrillar and granular components.
